chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker
Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Nico B Giacomantonio was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel Meeting on June 17, 2015 or 30 days Huber Consecutive.

miscConds.notes:
Cash Bail Applied to Fine/Fees/DNA Surcharge.  DNA Surcharge Paid In Full.  The remaining Fine and Fees To be paid as a Condition of Probation at the rate of $100.00 per month starting 11-01-2015; alternate - find defendant contemptuous and serve 4 days Jail.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Blood Test Reimbursement:  $24.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to City of Brookfield Police Department.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
Be involved in a 12 step program within the First 30 days and have a sponsor within the First 60 days of Probation.

Count #5 is Dismissed.
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time:  120 Days Huber - Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence forthwith.
Credit For Time Served 4 Days.
Each year of Probation.  The 20 hours in the Second Year of Probation is to be completed by 03 of 2017.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Nico B Giacomantonio in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 4.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 1, 2 and 3 dismissed and read-in. Ct. 5 dismissed by operation of law. 


Court orders the following: 
Ct. 4:
- 12 months jail with huber STAYED for 2 years Probation
-  30 months Drivers License Revocation. 
-  30 months Ignition Interlock every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel meeting on June 17, 2015 or 30 days Huber consecutive.
- Alcohol Assessment 
- Fine totaling: $2252.00 to be paid at rate of $100.00 per month commencing November 1, 2015; alternate - find defendant contemptuous and serve 4 days jail - apply bail. To be paid as a condition of probation
- Transcript fees of $20.00 - append to fine
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 - append to fine
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $24.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to City of Brookfield Police Department -  append to fine. 
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety.   No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Sign all medical releases. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling. Not operate motor vehicle without valid DL.  12 step program - to be involved in within first 30 days and have a sponsor within the first 60 days.  
- Defendant to perform 20 hours of community service each year of Probation. The 20 hours in the 2nd year of Probation is to be completed by March of 2017.
- 120 days jail with huber Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing FORTHWITH.  4 days credit. Non-working hours with standard release conditions. 
Defendant was remanded to the custody of the Sheriff to commence the sentence.
